titleStmt.title: John Quincy Adams Diary Digital Project

list.head: of Kentucky. visitors of curiosity

list.item:
Mumford— Applies to be Keeper of light-house— Nayat
Point—
Clay— Revised note to Krudener— Larned to go to Peru— Despatches from Tudor— Peace
Fendall Pardon to Winebago Indians.

list.head: Visitors— Ministers of the Episcopal Church— Assembled in this City—
list.item: Adams.

St. John’s Heard Mr Meade. 1. John 4.10. 22d. after Trinity.
Communion day.

div.p: 3. IV:15. Ride— College— Post-office— Rain. Drenched

list.item: Abigail S. Adams went to Baltimore—
Fendall Ph. R.— Pardons of Winebago Indians, for murder 2d. Degree

Porter— Peter B— Scott’s refusal of Obedience— Winebagoes— Letter
to Scott— Proposal to revoke his brevet

list.head: Brother in Law to J. Sergeant, and his nephew—from Philadelphia— Sergeant’s election lost—
list.item: Lober.
Nourse— C. J— Letters from Scott, Command of the Army in 1821.
Lincoln Levi j. Midshipman— going to Norfolk.
Southard S. L. Scientific exhibition— Wilkes, Reynolds— Pendleton
Clay— Henry— Project of Treaty with Austria.
Jones— Coll. Roger— absent yesterday. Fenwick & Clinch Letters.
Nourse— Ch. J. Came for Scott’s Letters to Command army in 1821.
M’Kenney. T. L. Medals for Winebago Indians— The Pardon.
Cass— Lewis. Indian visit of Ceremony this day— No business
Porter. Peter B— with the Indians. Forsyth interpreter and another
Winebago Indians 12. one woman—2 Speeches—half-breed

list.head: Visits friendly.
list.item: M’Intosh of Norfolk.
Addison— Wine—
L. Lincoln dined with us— Ride to the woods—

Middlesex Canal Shares 755. 756.
transferred to Charles—

div.p: 5. III.45. Charles left us— Ride before dinner—

list.item: Southard S. L— Waters Smith’s claim for the Negroes.
Jones— Roger— Fenwick and Clinch question of double rations.

list.head: Visits— Mr Gallatin is here upon the subject of the North Eastern boundary question
Cabinet Meeting— Letter from Genl. Porter to Scott Question of revoking his Brevet, not determined— To have another Meeting
list.item: Southard S. L.

Hatch Israel. Comes from Long-Island his embarrassments.
Loss of custom at his Inn, by Steam-boat speed.
M’Keehan David— Wants place— totally deaf
Clay Henry— The Treaty with Austria, Messenger to Hughes
Jones— Roger— Papers in the case of Fenwick and Clinch—

list.head: Vistors— the Duke has been to Canada— going with Bresson to South-America

list.item: Scott Alexander— Wishes to occupy the house near Carbery’s.—

Barrell— S. B. Applies for the Consulate General at Algiers
for his Cousin— Surprised to hear of obstacles.
Hopkins of Northampton
His Son—

Pederson— P.
recently returned
from Copenhagen, as
Minister Resident in
return for our Chargé
d’Affaires who is very
acceptable.
John and W. S. Smith dined at Mr Clay’s.
Sentence of Genl. Court Martial on board U.S. Sloop of War Lexington at Port Mahon. 9. Augt 1828 dismissing acting Midshipman George B. Wingerd for Drunkenness— approved
Signed 619. Land-Grants
Exequatur to Alexis Eustaphieff Consul General of Russia, at New-York—
Hatch Israel— Going to-morrow or next day—will call again
Nourse— C. J. twice— Papers and Books on Scott’s claim
Brent— Daniel— Tudor’s Letters— Case of the Spermo—
Rush— Richard— Observations on Scott’s claim
Biddle— James— Returned from Coast of Brazil.
Letter from my Son George enclosing copies of two Letters from W. B. Giles.

Heard Bigelow— John 9–27. Will ye also be his
disciples.
Gales— Joseph jr.— W. B. Giles’s Letters in 1808.9
Hawley. 23d. Sunday after Trin: Phil. 2.12–13.
Wilson— David. an Irishman from Belfast—
Forsyth— Midshipman—for appointmt. in Marine Corps—
Southard— Saml. L. Commission to Stewart as Chaplain in the Navy.
Wirt— William— Genl. Scott’s claim to command Macomb.
M’Kee John. M.H.R.U.S. from Alabama.
Frye. Nathl. junr.— Accounts of payments for T. J. Hellen

div.p: 11. V. Tuesday.— Walk to foot of College Hill—

list.item:
Graham— George— Reservations of Kanzas Treaty 3. June 1824
Also, Cherokee Improvements W. of Mississippi.

list.head: Cabinet Meeting— Scott’s Letter of 1. Novr asking for a furlough.— Porter’s draught of Letter to him.

list.item: Hennington— Dog and bird exhibition
No visitors

Signed Lead-mine Licenses from
N. 57 to 65. except N. 64.

Southard— S. L. Secy War’s draft of Letter to Genl. Scott—
left with me for addition.

Rodgers— John— Letters from Offley at Smyrna— Bulletin
Turkish— G. B. English.
Election politics and beggary.

list.head: Mr Hammett a Clergyman from Virginia
list.item: Hammett—
Rush— Richard— Treasury Estimates for the Message.
Wilkes— Lieutt. Ch— Letter from Ch. King— To be Astronomer on the Southern Ocean expedition
company to dine.
Macomb— Alexr Board of Officers in April 1815. Precedence between him and Scott— His Statement—

list.head: Tharp’s new Memorial, written by Coxe— Ambrose— Fairfax County Election news.

list.item: Order to discharge from prison John Sullivan. Washington County Assault and Battery.

div.p: 15. V. Saturday. Lee’s Life of Arthur Lee finished— Ride

list.item:
Clay— Henry— Treaty with Austria— Baron Lederer scruples
signing— Minutes for the Message.
Southard— S. L. with papers— Will come on Monday.

Porter Peter B. Letter to Scott— My addition inserted— To be
sent to-night—
Heard Bigelow. Luke 19.41
Heard Hawley— St. John’s. Philippians 4.15–20.19.

div.p: 17. VI. Monday— Round Capitol Square Walk—

list.item: Conner. Captain B. Wants employment to remove Sandbars—
Fendall— Ph. R. Letter to M’Pherson consul at Carthagena—

Southard Saml. L. The South Pole Expedition— Jones to command—
Instruments to be purchased—
Clay— Henry Baron Lederer declines signing the Treaty.
Rush— Richard Letters from T. Law— Rush’s Minutes of 1825. and 6
Macomb Alexander— His Statement— Lambert and Belton—
Tharp— William. Returned him his papers— Declined a decision.

list.head: Maps of the North-eastern Boundary. Surveys by the States of Massachusetts and Maine. Letters from B. Vaughan—

list.item: Preble. W. P.— from Maine

div.p: 18. V:30. Tuesday— Ground covered with Snow

list.item:
Cass— Lewis— Going to Baltimore— Winebagoes— To ask them for their lead-
mine Lands— Medals. 2 large— 3. To take out the old
heart?, and put in a new one.
Signed Lead-mine Leases from 125 to 129.

M’lean John— P.M.G— His annual report. S. L. Gouverneur
P.M. at New-York. N. Low at Portland.
Anderson. Alexander. His claim for extra-service— Going away
Abrams— Isaac— Revd. 5. To build a Church in Baltimore.
An hour’s walk before dinner— Ground covered with Snow.
Thumlert— William— Gave him the Letter to him from Crommelin’s

Lost his inheritance 539. Pittiless— thinks nothing of it, the sum
being so small.

Signed consent to the conveyance by John B. Boure of Indian descent of one half of two Sections of Land, one reserved to him by 6. Article of Treaty with Potawatamis of 16. Octr. 1826. the other by 3d. Article of Treaty with Miamis of 23. Octr. 1826.

div.p: 19. VI. Wednesday. Snow disappeared— Walk before dinner

list.item: Gardner. Captain— Young Fleury’s Story— Calhoun. M’Duffie &c

list.head: Mail contractors from the State of New-York— Garnsey has lost his election for being a free-mason— Marvin the same— Administration Electors chosen in their Districts by large majorities
list.item: Garnsey.
Burt.
Two Others

list.head: Anderson came to introduce Dederick and to take leave—
list.item: Dederick.
Crowell— John— Claims of the Creek Indians—for balance of 250,000
Porter— Peter B. Another Letter of disobedience from Scott.

Connell. John Report concerning Indian Intercourse
from Philadelphia.

list.head: With Letter from Archbishop Cheverus of Bordeaux—
list.item: Another.
Macomb. Alexander.— with a certificate from Lambert—

Rush Richard. A. Anderson’s claim— Precedents to be examined— I read to Mr Rush the draught of Paragraphs for the message— He doubted the expediency of introducing them. In relation to the Constitutionality of the Tariff Law; and the commercial intercourse with Great-Britain.
J. Connell dined with us— Paragraph for the Message respecting Indians. Letter from C. F. A. to his Mother— Offence taken by Federalists at Boston at Statement in National Intelligencer.

div.p: 20. V:45. Thursday— Heavy Rain— Walk round Capitol Square

list.head:
Cooper is a Son of Isaac Cooper and Grandson of William Cooper of Boston. Has been an acting Purser in the Mediterranean and wants an ap-
pointment—

list.item: Frye. N. jr. Mrs and Tom— Oyster supper and up till 11.
Samuel on the British Army— Letters on the Army Register. of 1826— Brevet-Rank. Commissions in the British Army.
Graham— George— Employment of Choctaw Indian funds—
Gardner. Captn. The South-Carolina Treachery and Calhoun—
Southard— S. L. The South-Sea expedition preparations—
Clay— Henry— Lederer’s new proposals and motives.

list.head: Old Mail Contractor from Utica, with a Letter from Alexander Johnson.—
list.item: Story.
25. or 30. N.Y. Mail contractors— Their visit round the house—
Bowdoin Temple— Going soon again to England—
Roberdeau— Isaac— Declining health—dyspepsia.
Nourse— Charles J.— Letter of Secy of War to Gl. Gaines—

Wirt— William— Long conversation with him upon Mr Jefferson.
Read to him mine to W. B. Giles.

Connell— John— Claims upon Denmark—his powers from the
Claimants. Instructions to Wheaton.

list.head: Mr Clay gave me to read a Letter from James Brown, Minister at Paris.

list.item: Southard Saml. L. Five plans of Navy Yard, to be approved.
Confined all day to the house— Draft of Message and Scott’s case— Read to Mr Southard paragraphs of the Message—does not approve them—
Mr Southard— J. Connell— Temple Bowdoin and Dr Morris dined with us.
Heard Bigelow— John 16.33.
At St. John’s Heard Hawley 1. Peter 1.2. 25. After Trinity
Shaler— W— Turkish Manuscripts. Beber Language. Hodgson.
Hammond— Jabez D. from Albany.

list.head: Mr Southard introduced his nephew—and left with me his report upon Navy Department affairs
list.item: Southard— Daniel.
Knapp— S. L— His pamphlet on Masonry— Φ.B.K.

list.head: Jones comes with a Message from Red Jacket Asks to be re-appointed Interpreter.
list.item: Jones. Horatio.
Ross. of Pennsa. Curiosity— Says he is ashamed of his State—
Nourse— C. J. With papers from the War Department and copy.
Garnsey— His distress and want of an appointment—
Abigail S. Adams came home

div.p: 25. V.15. Tuesday— Ride round— Cabinet Meeting

list.head: Mrs Williams came for her papers. To come again tomorrow— Ringgold will not pay her—

list.item: Rush. R. With Statement of the revenue for the year.
Bigelow Andrew— Visit— interrupted—
Nourse— Ch. J— Copy of my paper— Scott’s pamphlet Letter—

list.head: Winebago Indians— To receive them again next Saturday— Their dance Friday
Cabinet Meeting— Draft of the Message read— They then took it to the War Dept. Office; read it over again and suggested several slight alterations— They returned at 6. in the Eve and dined with us—

list.item: Reynolds Of the South Sea and Pacific Ocean voyage of discovery— Wishes a third vessel to be employed— Also that S. L. Knapp should go as purser, and writer of the Narrative—
Genl. Scott— suspended from command— Western Department.

list.head: She took back her papers—

list.item: Derrick. W. S— Instructions to James Brown—
Brent— Daniel— Additional Article Treaty with Hanse Towns
Duncan. Joseph— Genl. M.H.R. from Illinois
Shepherd. Augustine H. Member H.R. from North-Carolina
Knight. N. R. Senator U.S. from Rhode-Island just re-elected.
White Joseph M— Delegate from Florida— Trials of Land Causes
Rush— Richard. Proposed Alteration of Message— About Civil War—
Southard Saml. L. Navy Documents— South Sea Expedition—
Shaler— W. Took back Hodgson’s Manuscripts and his own—
Nourse C. J— Documents for the Message from the War Office

list.head: Contractor upon the Chesapeake and Ohio Canal—

list.item: Trumbull. John— Finished the work upon his pictures.
Seaton— W. W. and Mrs— here this Evening at tea.

div.p: 28. V. Friday— Walk— round Capitol Square

list.item: Elgar— Joseph— Asked for his Report on the public Buildings

list.head: Members of Congress from Massachusetts—just arrived. Mrs Everett is with her husband— None of the other Ladies.

list.item: Southard S. L— Read me his Report, to go with the Message
Rodgers— John. Letter from David Offley. Smyrna—
Nourse C. J— Took the Reports from the War Office
Frye. N. and Tom, to see the Indians dance
Clay. Henry— Tacon’s complaint— Salmon vs Kirk.
Cass. Lewis— The Winebago Indian War Dance—front of house
Everett Edward— dined with us— Sat with me in the Evening.

div.p: 29. V:15. Saturday— Ride round College and Capitol.

list.head: Members of Congress coming in. Chaplain to be appointed for the South Sea Voyage of Discovery. Additions to the Message— Execution of the Act for the gradual improvement of the Navy— Received Elgar’s Report on the Public buildings— Penitentiary— Slave indemnity Commission closed—

list.item: Hendricks William.
Winebago Indians.

div.p: Long talk with the Winebago Indians. Smoked the pipe of Peace with them— Gave them Medals— Rifles, Pistols and Sabres. Three Speakers—one Chief said to be 96 years old. Told me he and I were about of the same age— I exhorted them to Peace and Friendship— Told them they had better let us have the land where the lead was of no use to them— Gave them the pardon of the two Chiefs sentenced to Death for Murder— Told them I had never pardoned a white man for that crime— They said they must consult their Nation about the land; and next Spring they would let us have a small piece of land— But they had some debts which they wanted to have paid.— They said the white people had swarmed upon their lands, till the game had all disappeared, and there was not a Rabbit to be found— The talk lasted three hours

list.item: Heard Bigelow Psalm 48.9.

list.head: General Bernard introduced Mr Peugnet who keeps a french and classical School or Academy— Mr Bell and Mr Robbins Senators U.S. from New Hampshire and Rhode Island—
list.item: Peugnet.

div.p: No afternoon service at St. John’s Church— Here ends the Month— I wrote this Morning the last paragraphs of the Message— And I am still much occupied with the observations on Scott’s claim of Brevet command. I find it absolutely impossible to keep up the current of my Diary.
